The passage describes a pivotal moment when Tom Sawyer courageously takes the blame for tearing a book to protect Becky Thatcher from punishment. Despite receiving a harsh punishment of being whipped and detained after school, Tom feels it was worth it to see the adoration in Becky's eyes. Initially planning revenge on the real culprit Alfred Temple, Tom's vengeful feelings give way to pleasurable thoughts about Becky's admiration of his noble deed.
